intro: Scabiosa bellidifolia, commonly known as the Italian rock rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to white, bloom in late spring to early summer. Scabiosa bellidifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
